article.headline: Manhattan 67, Rhode Island 58
article.story: NEW YORK (AP) -- Freshman center Arturo Dubois scored 10 of his 14 points during an early second-half surge, and Manhattan rallied to defeat Rhode Island 67-58 Tuesday night. Manhattan (2-0) trailed 30-23 at halftime but opened the second half with a 17-8 run. The 6-foot-8 Dubois repeatedly worked inside to spark the Jaspers during that stretch. With Rhode Island (1-1) leading 44-42, Manhattan went ahead to stay on three successive 3-pointers from guard Jason Wingate. The last of those, a 3 from the right side, gave the Jaspers a 51-44 advantage with 8:23 left. Scott Hazelton paced the Rams with 23 points. They missed all six 3-point attempts while Manhattan shot 6-of-18 from long range. Rhode Island also was hurt by the Jaspers' full-court pressure, committing 22 turnovers. Peter Mulligan scored 14 points for Manhattan, and C.J. Anderson added 12.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
